author: EFE
title: Llegan primeros soldados norcoreanos a la zona de combate en Kursk, seg√∫n Kiev
text:
Los primeros soldados norcoreanos ya han llegado al frente de la guerra en la regi√≥n rusa de Kursk, fronteriza con Ucrania y donde las tropas ucranianas ocupan parte del territorio tras la incursi√≥n en agosto pasado, asegur√≥ este jueves la inteligencia militar ucraniana, GUR.
‚ÄúLas primeras unidades del ej√©rcito de la Rep√∫blica Popular Democr√°tica de Corea, entrenadas en los campos de entrenamiento del este de Rusia, ya han llegado a la zona de combate de la guerra ruso-ucraniana. En concreto, el 23 de octubre se registr√≥ su aparici√≥n en la regi√≥n rusa de Kursk‚Äù, afirm√≥ el GUR en su canal de Telegram.
Seg√∫n la inteligencia militar de Ucrania, el n√∫mero de soldados norcoreanos desplegados en Rusia es actualmente de unas 12 mil, de las que 500 son oficiales, entre ellos 3 generales.
Esos soldados son entregados en 5 campos de entrenamiento militar situados en el este de Rusia y el responsable de supervisar el adiestramiento corresponde al viceministro ruso de Defensa Yunus-Bek Yevkurov.
‚ÄúA los soldados enviados por Pyonyang se les proporciona munici√≥n, ropa de cama, ropa y calzado de invierno, as√≠ como art√≠culos de higiene. En concreto, Mosc√∫ proporcionar√° mensualmente 50 metros de papel higi√©nico y 300 gramos de jab√≥n a cada soldado norcoreano, seg√∫n las normas establecidas‚Äù, escribe el GUR
La inteligencia militar ucraniana afirma que se destinan varias semanas a la coordinaci√≥n del Ej√©rcito norcoreano, que Rusia pretende utilizar en la guerra contra Ucrania.
El Pent√°gono dijo el mi√©rcoles por primera vez tener constancia de la presencia de tropas norcoreanas en territorio ruso, al tiempo que el Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia (NIS) surcoreano estim√≥ en unos 3 mil el n√∫mero de soldados enviados ya por Pyongyang a la Federaci√≥n Rusa, donde estar√≠an recibiendo instrucci√≥n para unirse a las tropas rusas que luchan en Ucrania.

author: Ant√≠a Paz,Agencias
title: "Es un s√≠ntoma de autoodio y de clara galegofobia": el BNG denuncia la pol√≠tica de normalizaci√≥n ling√º√≠stica del concello de Vigo
text:
Sociedad
‚ÄúEs un s√≠ntoma de autoodio y de clara galegofobia‚Äù: el BNG denuncia la pol√≠tica de normalizaci√≥n ling√º√≠stica del concello de Vigo
Xabier P√©rez Igrexas denuncia que el alcalde es el primero en incumplir la normativa municipal
El grupo municipal del BNG en Vigo pide que el concello se convierta en un "agente normalizador" del gallego, ante el retroceso de su uso en la ciudad m√°s grande de Galicia, y ha censurado que la ordenanza municipal de Normalizaci√≥n Ling√º√≠stica es "sistem√°ticamente incumplida" por el gobierno local de Abel Caballero.
"Es irracional y un s√≠ntoma de autoodio y de clara 'galegofobia' que Abel Caballero insista en destinar a actividades de normalizaci√≥n de nuestro idioma menos del 5 % de lo que gasta en las becas de ingl√©s", ha advertido el portavoz del grupo nacionalista, Xabier P√©rez Igrexas, que ha se√±alado que el alcalde es "el primero" en vulnerar la normativa municipal, que fija el gallego como idioma oficial y lengua vehicular del concello.
Realizaci√≥n de un estudio socioling√º√≠stico
P√©rez Igrexas ha llamado al gobierno local a "abandonar la inercia" y poner en marcha medidas para extender el uso del gallego, entre las que propone la realizaci√≥n de un estudio socioling√º√≠stico en colaboraci√≥n con la Universidade de Vigo para conocer la situaci√≥n de la lengua en la ciudad, ya que el √∫ltimo informe data del a√±o 2002. "Un punto de partida para llevar adelante las medidas necesarias para la normalizaci√≥n de su uso", ha explicado.
Por otra parte, ha pedido tambi√©n "un ambicioso programa de promoci√≥n de la lengua gallega", dotado al menos con 150.000 euros, y que se renueve de forma urgente el Consello Social da Lingua, pendiente desde 2019.
topics: Religion and Belief->relations between religion and government

author: Simone Gibson
title: Man pretending to be law enforcement, making threats to get his case dropped receives 5 years in prison
text:
by: Simone Gibson
Posted: Jun 12, 2024 / 03:57 PM EDT
Updated: Jun 12, 2024 / 03:57 PM EDT
SHARE
MACON, Ga. ( WRBL ) ‚Äì A Georgia resident with a lengthy criminal history of making death threats and arson was sentenced to serve 60 months behind bars in federal prison after falsely claiming to be a U.S. Secret Service and FBI agent in an attempt to get his case drop while in custody on Wednesday.
The U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office for the Middle District of Georgia said 56-year-old Travis Leroy Ball from Barnesville, Georgia, received a 60-month-long prison sentence along with three years of supervised release on Wednesday. Ball previously pled guilty to mailing threatening communications on Jan. 19.
Based on court records and statements filed in court, the FBI obtained a letter on March 10, 2023, addressed to U.S. Court Judge Marc. Treadwell, where the writer pretended to be a U.S. Secret Service agent who investigated the defendant‚Äôs prior case. The letter, which authorities later determined was written by Ball, demanded that charges in Ball‚Äôs recent case should be dismissed and that he should be released.
Ball also used the name of a former cellmate to write letters to the U.S. District Court in Valdosta, Georgia, and the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development in Washington D.C. in March and May of 2023. The letters threatened to kill employees and demanded that Ball‚Äôs photos and personal information be removed from jail records.
The U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office said Ball even sent a letter to the Upson County Sheriff‚Äôs Office in July 2023, pretending to be an FBI agent working on a top-secret case demanding Ball‚Äôs photos and personal information be deleted from jail records.
After obtaining the letters, the FBI compared the letters, handwriting, postage stamps, letterhead, verbiage and the ‚ÄúINMATE MAIL‚Äù stamps and determined that Ball wrote the letters while in custody.
Ball‚Äôs DNA was also compared to the letter sent to the U.S. Courthouse in Valdosta and the letter sent to Treadwell. The results confirmed Ball‚Äôs DNA on each letter. Authorities found writing materials and stamps in Ball‚Äôs cell as well.
The FBI the U.S. Department of Homeland Security Federal Protective Services, the U.S. Secret Service, the U.S. Marshals Service and the Upson County Sheriff‚Äôs Office investigated Ball‚Äôs case. Deputy Criminal Chief Will Keyes prosecuted the case.

organizations.name: office for the middle district of georgia

author: Raimondo De Magistris
title: Gli ultras del Bologna si schierano col Sindaco Lepore: \"La complicit\u00e0 dell'indifferenza\"
text: Gli ultras del Bologna si schierano col Sindaco Lepore: "La complicit√† dell'indifferenza" I gruppi della Curva Andrea Costa dello stadio Dall'Ara si schierano dalla parte del Sindaco di Bologna Matteo Lepore in merito alla decisione di rinviare Bologna-Milan. "La complicit√† dell'indifferenza", il titolo del comunicato. Questo il testo: "Ognuno di noi sta vivendo in questi giorni la tragedia che ha colpito la nostra citt√† e il nostro territorio. Non ci sono pi√π lacrime, ora parler√† l'orgoglio che ci contraddistingue e che ci far√† rialzare. Nelle nostre famiglie, nelle nostre case, nei nostri luoghi di lavoro, nei nostri luoghi di aggregazione. Nonostante il fango che ci sta ostacolando, la fatica a raggiungere il posto di lavoro, la fatica nello spalare via col fango un'intera vita". Poi in un altro passaggio: "Non si possono muovere 35mila persone in una delle zone pi√π colpite della citt√†, mentre c'√® chi a pochi metri di distanza √® fuori da casa. Fuori da casa sua. Qualora si decidesse comunque di giocare a porte aperte, i gruppi della Curva Andrea Costa diserteranno Bologna-Milan in programma sabato. E considereranno complici tutti quelli che vorranno mettere in scena uno spettacolo cos√¨ grottesco". Pubblicato da[Forever Ultras Bologna 1974]su[Gioved√¨ 24 ottobre 2024] [Editoriale di Luca Marchetti L‚ÄôInter la spunta con i titolari, il Milan quando esce Leao. Juve: cerotti e mercato, l‚ÄôAtalanta in Europa il pallone non entra!](/editoriale/l-inter-la-spunta-con-i-titolari-il-milan-quando-esce-leao-juve-cerotti-e-mercato-l-atalanta-in-europa-il-pallone-non-entra-2026772)

author: Brooke Sjoberg
title: 'No wonder Barebells taste like candy bars': Woman eats 6 Barebells Protein Bars in 1 day. Then she finds out the truth about them
text:
There is so much conflicting information about health, fitness, and what supplements are best for reaching your goals. As a result, it can be devastating to learn that something you relied on is not ‚Äúgood for you.‚Äù
Featured Video However, the idea of ‚Äúgood for you‚Äù can be entirely subjective.
One superfan of the protein bar brand Barebells says she was supremely disappointed to see a content creator review multiple brands of protein bars. They ranked her personal favorite in dead last.
In the video that has drawn over 733,000 views on TikTok , content creator Shannon Zhao (@shannonthebaby) says she was heartbroken to learn that her favorite brand of protein bars was ranked so lowly. And that‚Äôs not just because she once ate six of them in one day.
Advertisement ‚ÄúGuys, I‚Äôm really upset because I just watched this video of a guy ranking protein bars,‚Äù Zhao says in the video. ‚Äú10 different protein bars from worst to best, and Barebells was ranked 10, as in the worst for you. And I have one pretty much every single day. I was just thinking about the time where I had six in one day because I got the super rare international flavors off of TikTok shop, and I obviously couldn‚Äôt help myself to try all six of them.‚Äù
It is unclear which content creator she is referring to.
The Daily Dot has reached out to Zhao via email and TikTok direct message, as well as to Barebells via email regarding the video.
Why do people dislike Barebells? Since launching in 2016, Barebells has found itself on several lists of recommendations for protein bars, from Cosmopolitan to Coachweb , gaining additional popularity on TikTok.
Advertisement The bars are generally recommended based on their ratio of protein to calories , as most of the brand‚Äôs offerings clock in at 20 grams of protein for about 210 calories. Customers also say they enjoy the taste of Barebells better than other protein bars.
However, some folks are critical of the protein bar brand, which uses artificial sweeteners, artificial flavors, and other ingredients that raise concerns for some . But this is entirely subjective. One dietitian rated Barebells 45 out of 100 because of saturated fats and ultra-processed ingredients. Another dietician recommends the bars as a snack to help meet protein goals.
Are they actually good for you? The answer to this is not exactly straightforward. It really depends on how you feel about the ingredients included, and any sensitivities to them that you might have.
Advertisement For example, the sugar alcohols in the bars might present an issue for those with sensitive stomachs, and folks seeking simpler formulas might not find that the bars fit the bill.
However, as several viewers noted in the comments of the video, 20 grams of protein to 210 calories per bar is a ratio that many who regularly consume protein bars would consider good.
What do Barebells fans think? Despite raising red flags for some, several viewers pointed out that Barebells are vastly preferable to them. This is due to the flavor and texture of other protein bars on the market.
Advertisement ‚ÄúBarebells are the only protein bars I see people actively eat,‚Äù one commenter wrote.
‚ÄúThey are the only protein bars I don‚Äôt hate so I will be ignoring this LOL,‚Äù another said.
‚ÄúBarebells and Built Puffs are the only ones I can eat,‚Äù a further user added.
@shannonthebaby No wonder Barebells taste like candy bars üò≠üò≠
‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Shannon Zhao Advertisement Others were skeptical of what the content creator Zhao referenced had to say about the bars and their reasoning for ranking them so low.
‚ÄúThat guy doesn‚Äôt know what he‚Äôs talking about queen, he‚Äôs just going off vibes not anything legitimate,‚Äù one commenter wrote.
‚ÄúDo you guys not read/understand the nutrition info??‚Äù another said. ‚Äú20g protein 200 cal and some sugar is whatever not great but form your own opinions who cares ab a tiktok ranking.‚Äù
‚ÄúLet me guess that person is trying to sell something of theirs if u go on their account,‚Äù a third added.
Advertisement
Internet culture is chaotic‚Äîbut we‚Äôll break it down for you in one daily email. Sign up for the Daily Dot‚Äôs web_crawlr newsletter here . You‚Äôll get the best (and worst) of the internet straight into your inbox.

author: Rebecca Richard
title: Daggett Rock in Phillips is an awe-inspiring natural wonder, easily accessible
text:
Awe-inspiring Daggett Rock is seen June 15 in Phillips. Rebecca Richard/Franklin Journal
Daggett Rock, seen June 15 is split into three pieces, and has a path to follow through the split in the rock which is located in Phillips. Rebecca Richard/Franklin Journal
Daggett Rock, the largest glacially transported erratic in Maine is an awe-inspiring natural wonder located in Phillips. Glaciers can transport chunks of rock over long distances. When these rocks are eventually deposited, they are often far from their original location. These transported rocks are called glacial erratics. Erratics provide a record of the glacier‚Äôs journey.
According to mainetrailfinder.com , one legend says, Daggett, a local woodsman, found the rock while drunk during a violent storm. He climbed on top of it and cursed his bad luck. Suddenly, a bolt of lightning struck the rock, splitting it into three pieces.
Daggett Rock measures 80 feet long, 30 feet wide and 25 feet high and is estimated to weigh 8,000 tons. This massive granite boulder with feldspar crystals likely originated from the Saddleback Mountain area. Geological evidence shows that Daggett Rock split when it was deposited where it now sits thousands of years ago.
It is easily accessible via a short, rocky trail with an incline from Wheeler Hill Road. It is a rocky trail which makes the hike a bit of challenge as you must watch out for loose rocks to avoid tripping. Daggett Rock sits prominently at the end of the trail, you can‚Äôt miss it. It is a beautiful sight, as you get to the top of the hill and the light pours in as you reach the clearing around the enormous rock. It is worth the journey for young and old. Children love trying to climb on the huge rock. Visitors are advised to watch out for poison ivy. Depending on the time of year, mosquitoes could be a nuisance so keep that in mind as well.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning by NWS
text:
5 hours ago Check NWS updates here
Effective: 2024-12-12 15:48:00 EST Expires: 2024-12-12 19:00:00 EST Urgency: Expected Severity: Severe Certainty: Likely Instruction: Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area or conduct mitigation. Target Area: Lake Superior East of a line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI and West of a line from Grand Marais MI to the US/Canadian Border Beyond 5NM from shore * WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or greater occurring, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels.
* WHERE...Lake Superior East of a line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI and West of a line from Grand Marais MI to the US/Canadian Border Beyond 5NM from shore.
* WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening.
* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of stability.

author: @beforeitsnews
title: Race Hustler Robin DiAngelo Issues Response Following Humiliating ‚ÄòAm I Racist?‚Äô Cameo | Police State | Before It's News
text: Race Hustler Robin DiAngelo Issues Response Following Humiliating ‚ÄòAm I Racist?‚Äô Cameo Originally published via [Armageddon Prose Substack:](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly9hcm1hZ2VkZG9ucHJvc2Uuc3Vic3RhY2suY29tL3AvcmFjZS1odXN0bGVyLXJvYmluLWRpYW5nZWxvLWlzc3Vlcw==) Unfortunately, the full interaction in ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù between Matt Walsh and notorious race hustler Robin DiAngelo, as far as I‚Äôm aware, hasn‚Äôt leaked onto social media yet. Neither has my wife downloaded it for us to watch yet from one of her many Slavic media pirating websites, so I haven‚Äôt seen it. [https://x.com/FrankDeScushin/status/1815907178441552322](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9GcmFua0RlU2N1c2hpbi9zdGF0dXMvMTgxNTkwNzE3ODQ0MTU1MjMyMg==) But we now have a better idea of what happened, thanks to DiAngelo‚Äôs desperate and self-defeating efforts at PR damage control. Related: [Irony? State Department Bigots Issue ‚ÄòDo Not Travel‚Äô Haiti Advisory](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly9wam1lZGlhLmNvbS9iZW5iYXJ0ZWUvMjAyNC8wOS8yNC9pcm9ueS1kZXBhcnRtZW50LW9mLXN0YXRlLWJpZ290cy1pc3N1ZS1kby1ub3QtdHJhdmVsLWhhaXRpLWFkdmlzb3J5LW40OTMyNzc3) Via [RobinDiAngelo.com](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucm9iaW5kaWFuZ2Vsby5jb20vYWJvdXQtdGhhdC1maWxtLw==) (emphasis added): ‚ÄúBack in 2023, I was contacted by a group who claimed to be making a documentary film called Shades of Justice, about efforts to address racism in the United States. They planned to interview anti-racist activists, authors and thought leaders in service of supporting the cause of racial equity. They offered me between $10-20,000 for an interview. I said let‚Äôs meet in the middle with $15,000 and agreed to participate (I have since donated that sum to the NAACP Legal Defense Fund).‚Äù $15,000 for an interview! There were entire years back in the day that I spent slaving for corporate America for minimum wage in which I made less than what this lady copped for a single hour-long appearance to essentially demonize an entire ethnic group for their imaginary crimes. Some might call my experiences modern-day slavery. I was basically like one of those child factory laborers in The Jungle. Some might say I deserve reparations from the state for the de facto bondage I was placed in by Better Ingredients, Better Pizza‚Ñ¢ Papa John‚Äôs. Related: [New Hollywood Hate Flick: White People ‚ÄòThe Most Dangerous Animal on the Planet‚Äô](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly9wam1lZGlhLmNvbS9iZW5iYXJ0ZWUvMjAyMy8xMi8xOC9uZXctaG9sbHl3b29kLWhhdGUtZmxpY2std2hpdGUtcGVvcGxlLXRoZS1tb3N0LWRhbmdlcm91cy1hbmltYWwtb24tdGhlLXBsYW5ldC1uNDkyNDgyMg==) Continuing: ‚ÄúMatt asked what I thought about reparations for Black Americans. I said that I agreed with reparations but that it was not my area of expertise. He then pulled up a chair and invited a Black crew-member who went by ‚ÄúBen‚Äù to sit with us, took out his wallet and handed Ben some cash. He said that if I believed in reparations, I should also give Ben cash. While some Black people have asked white people to engage in reparations by giving directly to individuals, reparations are generally understood as a systemic approach to past and current injustice*. The way Matt set this up felt intended to put Ben and I on the spot. Because Matt was pushing this on us, I expressed my discomfort and checked in with Ben, to be sure he was okay with receiving cash in this way. Ben reassured me that he was, so I went to my wallet and handed him my cash and the interview ended‚Ä¶ I realized that they had lied about their agenda and I had been played. I spread the word on my networks. Unfortunately, last month I started receiving hateful and misogynistic emails. Some referenced the Daily Wire (Ben Shapiro‚Äôs website), which announced that the film is indeed being released. It is not titled Shades of Justice nor is it meant to support the anti-racist cause. It is a Borat-style mockumentary titled Am I Racist? and designed to humiliate and discredit anti-racist educators and activists. Their deception was carefully planned and well-funded. The website they had sent me was fake, as were their identities, the project title used in the legal waiver, their description of the project, and the last name they gave for Matt. The interviewer was in fact, Matt Walsh, a far-right provocateur backed by Shapiro and Daily Wire+ (and yes, wearing a wig).‚Äù *In other words, the bill for reparations should be footed by someone else, except in the extreme circumstance that she needs to save face in front of cameras when a black man asks her on the spot for what she claims to want to give freely. People like Robin are meant to get rich off of racism ‚Äî not pay for it! Ben Bartee is an independent Bangkok-based American journalist with opposable thumbs. Follow his stuff via [Substack](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly9hcm1hZ2VkZG9ucHJvc2Uuc3Vic3RhY2suY29tLw==). Also, keep tabs via [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ArmageddonProse). For hip Armageddon Prose t-shirts, hats, etc., peruse the [merch store](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly9hcm1hZ2VkZG9uLXByb3NlLnByaW50aWZ5Lm1lL3Byb2R1Y3Rz). Support always welcome via the [digital tip jar](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYnV5bWVhY29mZmVlLmNvbS9iZW5iYXJ0ZWU=). Bitcoin public address: bc1qvq4hgnx3eu09e0m2kk5uanxnm8ljfmpefwhaw Anyone can [join](/v3/login/new/). Anyone can contribute. Anyone can become informed about their world. author: Alya Shandra
title: EU fails to agree on ‚Ç¨5 billion annual Ukraine military aid fund - Euromaidan Press
text: At an emergency summit on 1 February, EU leaders did not make a decision to establish a special fund for military support of Ukraine, but European Council President Charles Michel says progress has been made. The standoff reflects broader debates over sustaining arms supplies to Ukraine long-term, amplified by US congressional holdups and the possibility of a Trump comeback. In a section concerning military support for Ukraine in a [statement](https://www.consilium.europa.eu/media/69866/20240201-special-euco-conclusions-mff-ukraine-en.pdf) released after the summit, the European Council emphasized the commitment to continue providing Ukraine with ‚Äútimely, predictable and stable military support‚Äù through the European Peace Facility, the work of the EU training mission for the Ukrainian military, and bilateral assistance. However, no decision has been made regarding the creation of the Ukraine Assistance Fund within the European Peace Facility, as President Zelenskyy [implored via video link](https://euromaidanpress.com/2024/02/01/zelenskyy-urges-eu-leaders-to-approve-billions-of-euros-for-weapons-fund/?swcfpc=1) during the meeting. The special ‚Ç¨20 billion fund is intended to provide stable military support to Ukraine over four years; the issue of its creation is planned to be resolved by March. The conclusions state that the Council of the EU aims to reach an agreement on creating the Ukraine Assistance Fund by early March by way of amendments to the 2021 Council Decision establishing the European Peace Facility. At the same time, European Council President Charles Michel noted that ‚Äúprogress‚Äù has been made on this issue. After almost 2 years of war, Ukraine remains and will remain a priority. We will continue our strong military assistance. Progress has been made in supporting Ukraine through the üá™üá∫Peace Facility and we will leave no effort spared to accelerate the delivery of ammunition to üá∫üá¶‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/eZQfoECv1T] ‚Äî Charles Michel (@CharlesMichel) [February 1, 2024] The statement confirmed the EU‚Äôs commitment to continue providing military support to Ukraine through the European Peace Facility, EU Military Assistance Mission in Ukraine, and bilateral military commitments of individual EU countries. The conclusions also emphasize the ‚Äúurgent need to accelerate the delivery of ammunition and missiles‚Äù in view of the commitment to provide Ukraine with one million artillery shells. EU leaders called on member states ‚Äúto explore all options to meet Ukraine‚Äôs needs.‚Äù EU High Representative Josep Borrelll originally proposed the four-year Ukraine Aid Fund in summer 2023, with ‚Ç¨5 billion allocated annually. The idea was revamped in January 2024, as the European Union [proposed establishing a Ukraine Assistance Fund to streamline military aid to Ukraine.](https://euromaidanpress.com/2024/01/20/bloomberg-eu-discusses-revamp-of-e5-billion-ukraine-military-aid-fund/) The fund would have an annual budget of approximately ‚Ç¨5 billion focused on joint procurement of weapons and training Ukrainian troops. This initiative aimed to shift from the current model of reimbursing EU states for supplies sent to Ukraine. According to [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/eu-grapples-with-future-military-aid-ukraine-2024-01-31/), the proposal for creating the Ukraine Assistane Fund gas faced resistance from Germany and France. At the center of the debate is the mechanism of operation of the European Peace Facility (EPF), which has been used to provide billions of euros in military aid to Ukraine since Russia‚Äôs invasion. The EPF operates as a reimbursement scheme, with EU members contributing according to their economic size and receiving payouts based on the amount of aid donated. The fund has been pivotal in enabling the EU bloc to supply offensive weapons to Ukraine for the first time. But divisions have emerged among members over the EPF‚Äôs future role as the war continues, Reuters says. Some nations see the EPF as an effective means of channeling long-term assistance to Kyiv and a model for greater EU defense integration. However, controversies have also arisen, with members clashing over claimed refunds. Most EU countries support injecting ‚Ç¨5 billion into the EPF to further help Ukraine. But Germany wants changes to the fund first, and approval has been held up for months. Germany has voiced concerns about its disproportionate contributions to the EPF while also providing billions in bilateral military aid to Ukraine. Chancellor Olaf Scholz said most EU nations were not providing enough support to Kyiv. On 28 January, Scholz [urged EU member nations to provide more aid to Ukraine](https://euromaidanpress.com/2024/01/28/scholz-urges-eu-states-to-provide-more-aid-to-ukraine/), with Germany committing ‚Ç¨7 billion in 2024, accounting for over half of the bloc‚Äôs total funding. Germany and France have called for the EPF to be reformed before being expanded. The standoff highlights debates over how to sustain EU military aid for Kyiv on an institutionalized, long-term basis. Though reaffirming their commitment, leaders have struggled to transform the bloc‚Äôs ad hoc approach, Reuters reports. Hungary initially opposed the creation of the fund, but on 25 January, [agreed](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-01-25/hungary-reverses-opposition-on-new-eu-weapons-fund-for-ukraine) to drop its objections.
